title: Native Americans for kids: Cherokee, Apache, Navajo, Iroquois and Sioux

multiple-choice.question: What is the main focus of this Kids Academy anthropology lesson?

options.label: A
options.text: Exploring outer space

options.label: B
options.text: Understanding the history of Native American tribes in the United States

options.label: C
options.text: Learning about famous European monarchs

options.label: D
options.text: Discovering the secrets of ancient Egyptian pyramids

multiple-choice.question: What type of shelter is highlighted in this lesson as being built by Native Americans?

options.label: A
options.text: Igloo

options.label: B
options.text: Teepee

options.label: C
options.text: Log cabin

options.label: D
options.text: House on stilts

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following nations are mentioned as famous Indian nations in this lesson?

options.label: A
options.text: Cherokee, Sioux, Navajo, Iroquois, and Apache

options.label: B
options.text: Comanche, Cheyenne, Osage, Pueblo, and Seminole

options.label: C
options.text: Hopi, Inca, Zuni, Haudenosaunee, and Creek

options.label: D
options.text: Ojibwe, Oneida, Natchez, Aztec, and Mayan

multiple-choice.question: How many native American tribes and nations are mentioned in this lesson?
What unique skills did Native Americans have, as mentioned in the lesson?

options.label: A
options.text: Building complex machinery

options.label: B
options.text: Hunting, fishing, and agriculture

options.label: C
options.text: Performing advanced medical procedures

options.label: D
options.text: Creating intricate artwork

multiple-choice.question: What is one way pigeons demonstrate variation within one species?

options.label: A
options.text: They have different colors on their wings.

options.label: B
options.text: They can recognize correctly spelled words among misspelled ones.

options.label: C
options.text: They have adapted to various environments.

options.label: D
options.text: Their size varies depending on the region they live in.

multiple-choice.question: What is an impressive ability that pigeons possess?

options.label: A
options.text: They can navigate using only their sense of smell.

options.label: B
options.text: Pigeons can recognize correctly spelled words among misspelled ones.

options.label: C
options.text: They have a keen understanding of the quality of drawings.

options.label: D
options.text: They are able to create visual maps of their surroundings.

options.label: A
options.text: By using only their sense of smell.

options.label: B
options.text: Pigeons rely on Earth's magnetic field for navigation.

options.label: C
options.text: They navigate by looking at the angle of the sun.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What is a common misconception about pigeons that the video clarifies?

options.label: A
options.text: Pigeons are not very intelligent birds.

options.label: B
options.text: Pigeons don't have any remarkable abilities.

options.label: C
options.text: Pigeons can't adapt to urban environments well.

options.label: D
options.text: People think all pigeon babies look ugly.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of pigeons in Charles Darwin's theory of natural selection?

options.label: A
options.text: They are an example of variation within one species.

options.label: B
options.text: Pigeons were the first animals to evolve through natural selection.

options.label: C
options.text: They demonstrate how humans have shaped animal evolution.

options.label: D
options.text: Pigeons helped prove Darwin's theory by showing adaptation in action.
